thread.title: Work underway to reduce risk of mudslides that halt train...
thread.title_full: Work underway to reduce risk of mudslides that halt train... | www.kirotv.com

author: KIRO 7 STAFF
title: Work underway to reduce risk of mudslides that halt train...
text:
As some Sounder riders on north line train may have noticed, construction work is underway on four slide-prone areas near Everett and Mukilteo.
The construction effort is part of the $16.1 million in federal funds targeting six areas near Everett and Mukilteo to reduce the risk of mudslides.
Several mudslides blocked train service in late winter and spring.
The work includes retaining walls, slide detection fences for early mudslide warning, erosion control and improved drainage systems. It will help keep trains running through the rainy season.
Two other projects between Edmonds and Mukilteo were completed in 2013; no train-blocking events occurred in those two areas during the last rainy season.
Meanwhile, many more riders are taking the Sounder north line this year. Through August, boardings were up 18 percent compared to 2014.
Want to talk about the news of the day? Watch free streaming video on the KIRO 7 mobile app and iPad app , and join us here on Facebook .
